appendix.title: Command Index
appendix.para: This appendix was automatically built from Roo 1.1.4.RELEASE [rev f787ce7].

Commands are listed in alphabetic order, and are shown in monospaced font with any mandatory options you must specify when using the command. Most commands accept a large number of options, and all of the possible options for each command are presented in this appendix.

section.title: Add On Commands
section.para: Add On Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.roobot.client.AddOnCommands.

section.title: addon feedback bundle
section.para: Provide anonymous ratings and comments on a Spring Roo Add-on (your feedback will be published publicly)

listitem.para: The bundle symbolic name for the add-on of interest; no default value (mandatory)
How much did you like this add-on?; no default value (mandatory)
Your comments on this add-on eg "this is my comment!"; limit of 140 characters; no default value

section.title: addon info bundle
section.para: Provide information about a specific Spring Roo Add-on

listitem.para: The bundle symbolic name for the add-on of interest; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: addon info id
section.para: Provide information about a specific Spring Roo Add-on

listitem.para: The bundle ID as presented via the addon list or addon search command; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: addon install bundle
section.para: Install Spring Roo Add-on

listitem.para: The bundle symbolic name for the add-on of interest; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: addon install id
section.para: Install Spring Roo Add-on

listitem.para: The bundle ID as presented via the addon list or addon search command; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: addon list
section.para: List all known Spring Roo Add-ons (up to the maximum number displayed on a single page)

listitem.para: Refresh the add-on index from the Internet; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
The maximum number of lines displayed per add-on; default: '2'
The maximum number of add-ons to list; default: '99'
Only display trusted add-ons in search results; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Only display community provided add-ons in search results; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Only display compatible add-ons in search results; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: addon remove
section.para: Remove Spring Roo Add-on

listitem.para: The bundle symbolic name for the add-on of interest; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: addon search
section.para: Search all known Spring Roo Add-ons

listitem.para: A comma separated list of search terms; default: '*'
Refresh the add-on index from the Internet; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
The maximum number of lines displayed per add-on; default: '2'
The maximum number of add-ons to list; default: '20'
Only display trusted add-ons in search results; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Only display compatible add-ons in search results; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Only display community provided add-ons in search results; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Only display add-ons in search results that offer this command; no default value

section.title: addon upgrade all
section.para: Upgrade all relevant Spring Roo Add-ons / Components for the current stability level
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: addon upgrade available
section.para: List available Spring Roo Add-on / Component upgrades

listitem.para: The stability level of add-ons or components which are presented for upgrading (default: ANY); no default value

section.title: addon upgrade bundle
section.para: Upgrade a specific Spring Roo Add-on / Component

listitem.para: The bundle symbolic name for the add-on to upgrade; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: addon upgrade id
section.para: Upgrade a specific Spring Roo Add-on / Component from a search result ID

listitem.para: The bundle ID as presented via the addon list or addon search command; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: addon upgrade settings
section.para: Settings for Add-on upgrade operations

listitem.para: The stability level of add-ons or components which are presented for upgrading; no default value

section.title: Backup Commands
section.para: Backup Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.backup.BackupCommands.

section.title: backup
section.para: Backup your project to a zip file
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: Classpath Commands
section.para: Classpath Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.classpath.operations.ClasspathCommands.

section.title: class
section.para: Creates a new Java class source file in any project path

listitem.para: The name of the class to create; no default value (mandatory)
Whether the generated class should have common Roo annotations; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Source directory to create the class in; default: 'SRC_MAIN_JAVA'
The superclass (defaults to java.lang.Object); default if option not present: 'java.lang.Object'
Whether the generated class should be marked as abstract; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: enum constant
section.para: Inserts a new enum constant into an enum

listitem.para: The name of the enum class to receive this field; default if option not present: '*'
The name of the constant; no default value (mandatory)
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: enum type
section.para: Creates a new Java enum source file in any project path

listitem.para: The name of the enum to create; no default value (mandatory)
Source directory to create the enum in; default: 'SRC_MAIN_JAVA'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: focus
section.para: Changes focus to a different type

listitem.para: The type to focus on; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: interface
section.para: Creates a new Java interface source file in any project path

listitem.para: The name of the interface to create; no default value (mandatory)
Source directory to create the interface in; default: 'SRC_MAIN_JAVA'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: Controller Commands
section.para: Controller Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.web.mvc.controller.ControllerCommands.

section.title: controller all
section.para: Scaffold controllers for all project entities without an existing controller

listitem.para: The package in which new controllers will be placed; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: controller scaffold
section.para: Create a new scaffold Controller (ie where we maintain CRUD automatically)

listitem.para: The path and name of the controller object to be created; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the entity object which the controller exposes to the web tier; default if option not present: '*'
The base path under which the controller listens for RESTful requests (defaults to the simple name of the form backing object); no default value
A comma separated list of operations (only create, update, delete allowed) that should not be generated in the controller; no default value

section.title: web mvc all
section.para: Scaffold Spring MVC controllers for all project entities without an existing controller

listitem.para: The package in which new controllers will be placed; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: web mvc scaffold
section.para: Create a new scaffold Controller (ie where Roo maintains CRUD functionality automatically)

listitem.para: The path and name of the controller object to be created; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the form backing type which the controller exposes to the web tier; default if option not present: '*'
The base path under which the controller listens for RESTful requests (defaults to the simple name of the form backing object); no default value
A comma separated list of operations (only create, update, delete allowed) that should not be generated in the controller; no default value

section.title: Creator Commands
section.para: Creator Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.creator.CreatorCommands.

section.title: addon create advanced
section.para: Create a new advanced add-on for Spring Roo (commands + operations + metadata + trigger annotation + dependencies)

listitem.para: The top level package of the new addon; no default value (mandatory)
Description of your addon (surround text with double quotes); no default value
Provide a custom project name (if not provided the top level package name will be used instead); no default value

section.title: addon create i18n
section.para: Create a new Internationalization add-on for Spring Roo

listitem.para: The top level package of the new addon; no default value (mandatory)
The locale abbreviation (ie: en, or more specific like en_AU, or de_DE); no default value (mandatory)
Fully qualified path to the messages_xx.properties file; no default value (mandatory)
The full name of the language (used as a label for the UI); no default value
Fully qualified path to flag xx.png file; no default value
Description of your addon (surround text with double quotes); no default value
Provide a custom project name (if not provided the top level package name will be used instead); no default value

section.title: addon create simple
section.para: Create a new simple add-on for Spring Roo (commands + operations)

listitem.para: The top level package of the new addon; no default value (mandatory)
Description of your addon (surround text with double quotes); no default value
Provide a custom project name (if not provided the top level package name will be used instead); no default value

section.title: addon create wrapper
section.para: Create a new add-on for Spring Roo which wraps a maven artifact to create a OSGi compliant bundle

listitem.para: The top level package of the new wrapper bundle; no default value (mandatory)
Dependency group id; no default value (mandatory)
Dependency artifact id); no default value (mandatory)
Dependency version; no default value (mandatory)
Dependency vendor name); no default value (mandatory)
Dependency license URL; no default value (mandatory)
Dependency documentation URL; no default value
Description of the bundle (use keywords with #-tags for better search integration); no default value
Provide a custom project name (if not provided the top level package name will be used instead); no default value
Contents of Import-Package in OSGi manifest; no default value

section.title: Data On Demand Commands
section.para: Data On Demand Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.dod.DataOnDemandCommands.

section.title: dod
section.para: Creates a new data on demand for the specified entity

listitem.para: The entity which this data on demand class will create and modify as required; default if option not present: '*'
The class which will be created to hold this data on demand provider (defaults to the entity name + 'DataOnDemand'); no default value
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: Dbre Commands
section.para: Dbre Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.dbre.DbreCommands.

section.title: database introspect
section.para: Displays database metadata

listitem.para: The database schema name; no default value (mandatory)
The file to save the metadata to; no default value
Display database views; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: database reverse engineer
section.para: Create and update entities based on database metadata

listitem.para: The database schema name; no default value (mandatory)
The package in which new entities will be placed; no default value
Create automatic integration tests for entities; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Reverse engineer database views; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
The tables to include in reverse engineering. Must be separated by spaces and enclosed by pairs of double quotes
The tables to exclude from reverse engineering. Must be separated by spaces and enclosed by pairs of double quotes
Include non-portable JPA @Column attributes such as 'columnDefinition'; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: Embedded Commands
section.para: Embedded Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.web.mvc.embedded.EmbeddedCommands.

section.title: web mvc embed document
section.para: Embed a document for your WEB MVC application

listitem.para: The id of the document; no default value (mandatory)
The id of the document; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the jspx view; no default value

section.title: web mvc embed finances
section.para: Embed a stock ticker into your WEB MVC application

listitem.para: The stock symbol; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the jspx view; no default value

section.title: web mvc embed generic
section.para: Embed media by URL into your WEB MVC application

listitem.para: The url of the source to be embedded; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the jspx view; no default value

section.title: web mvc embed map
section.para: Embed a map for your WEB MVC application

listitem.para: The location of the map (ie "Sydney, Australia"); no default value (mandatory)
The name of the jspx view; no default value

section.title: web mvc embed photos
section.para: Embed a photo gallery for your WEB MVC application

listitem.para: The provider of the photo gallery; no default value (mandatory)
The user id; no default value (mandatory)
The album id; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the jspx view; no default value

section.title: web mvc embed stream video
section.para: Embed a video stream into your WEB MVC application

listitem.para: The provider of the video stream; no default value (mandatory)
The stream id; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the jspx view; no default value

section.title: web mvc embed twitter
section.para: Embed twitter messages into your WEB MVC application

listitem.para: The search term to display results for; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the jspx view; no default value

section.title: web mvc embed video
section.para: Embed a video for your WEB MVC application

listitem.para: The id of the video; no default value (mandatory)
The id of the video; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the jspx view; no default value

section.title: web mvc embed wave
section.para: Embed Google wave integration for your WEB MVC application

listitem.para: The key of the wave; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the jspx view; no default value

section.title: Entity Commands
section.para: Entity Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.entity.EntityCommands.

section.title: embeddable
section.para: Creates a new Java class source file with the JPA @Embeddable annotation in SRC_MAIN_JAVA

listitem.para: The name of the class to create; no default value (mandatory)
Whether the generated class should implement java.io.Serializable; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: entity
section.para: Creates a new JPA persistent entity in SRC_MAIN_JAVA

listitem.para: Name of the entity to create; no default value (mandatory)
The superclass (defaults to java.lang.Object); default if option not present: 'java.lang.Object'
Whether the generated class should be marked as abstract; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Create automatic integration tests for this entity; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
The JPA table name to use for this entity; no default value
The JPA table schema name to use for this entity; no default value
The JPA table catalog name to use for this entity; no default value
The JPA identifier field name to use for this entity; no default value
The JPA identifier field column to use for this entity; no default value
The data type that will be used for the JPA identifier field (defaults to java.lang.Long); default: 'java.lang.Long'
The JPA version field name to use for this entity; no default value
The JPA version field column to use for this entity; no default value
The JPA @Inheritance value; no default value
Apply @MappedSuperclass for this entity; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Whether the generated class should implement java.io.Serializable; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
The persistence unit name to be used in the persistence.xml file; no default value
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
The name used to refer to the entity in queries; no default value

section.title: Felix Delegator
section.para: Felix Delegator are contained in org.springframework.roo.felix.FelixDelegator.

section.title: exit
section.para: Exits the shell
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: osgi find
section.para: Finds bundles by name

listitem.para: A bundle symbolic name to find; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi framework command
section.para: Passes a command directly through to the Felix shell infrastructure

listitem.para: The command to pass to Felix (WARNING: no validation or security checks are performed); default: 'help'

section.title: osgi headers
section.para: Display headers for a specific bundle

listitem.para: Limit results to a specific bundle symbolic name; no default value

section.title: osgi install
section.para: Installs a bundle JAR from a given URL

listitem.para: The URL to obtain the bundle from; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi log
section.para: Displays the OSGi log information

listitem.para: The maximum number of log messages to display; no default value
The minimum level of messages to display; no default value

section.title: osgi obr deploy
section.para: Deploys a specific OSGi Bundle Repository (OBR) bundle

listitem.para: The specific bundle to deploy; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi obr info
section.para: Displays information on a specific OSGi Bundle Repository (OBR) bundle

listitem.para: The specific bundle to display information for; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi obr list
section.para: Lists all available bundles from the OSGi Bundle Repository (OBR) system

listitem.para: Keywords to locate; no default value

section.title: osgi obr start
section.para: Starts a specific OSGi Bundle Repository (OBR) bundle

listitem.para: The specific bundle to start; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi obr url add
section.para: Adds a new OSGi Bundle Repository (OBR) repository file URL

listitem.para: The URL to add (eg http://felix.apache.org/obr/releases.xml); no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi obr url list
section.para: Lists the currently-configured OSGi Bundle Repository (OBR) repository file URLs
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: osgi obr url refresh
section.para: Refreshes an existing OSGi Bundle Repository (OBR) repository file URL

listitem.para: The URL to refresh (list existing URLs via 'osgi obr url list'); no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi obr url remove
section.para: Removes an existing OSGi Bundle Repository (OBR) repository file URL

listitem.para: The URL to remove (list existing URLs via 'osgi obr url list'); no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi ps
section.para: Displays OSGi bundle information

listitem.para: The format of bundle information; default: 'BUNDLE_NAME'

section.title: osgi resolve
section.para: Resolves a specific bundle ID

listitem.para: The specific bundle to resolve; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi scr config
section.para: Lists the current SCR configuration
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: osgi scr disable
section.para: Disables a specific SCR-defined component

listitem.para: The specific component identifier (use 'osgi scr list' to list component identifiers); no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi scr enable
section.para: Enables a specific SCR-defined component

listitem.para: The specific component identifier (use 'osgi scr list' to list component identifiers); no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi scr info
section.para: Lists information about a specific SCR-defined component

listitem.para: The specific component identifier (use 'osgi scr list' to list component identifiers); no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi scr list
section.para: Lists all SCR-defined components

listitem.para: Limit results to a specific bundle; no default value

section.title: osgi start
section.para: Starts a bundle JAR from a given URL

listitem.para: The URL to obtain the bundle from; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi uninstall
section.para: Uninstalls a specific bundle

listitem.para: The specific bundle to uninstall; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: osgi update
section.para: Updates a specific bundle

listitem.para: The specific bundle to update ; no default value (mandatory)
The URL to obtain the updated bundle from; no default value

section.title: osgi version
section.para: Displays OSGi framework version
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: Field Commands
section.para: Field Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.classpath.operations.FieldCommands.

section.title: field boolean
section.para: Adds a private boolean field to an existing Java source file

listitem.para: The name of the field to add; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the class to receive this field; default if option not present: '*'
Whether this value cannot be null; default if option present: 'true'
Whether this value must be null; default if option present: 'true'
Whether this value must assert false; default if option present: 'true'
Whether this value must assert true; default if option present: 'true'
The JPA @Column name; no default value
Inserts an optional Spring @Value annotation with the given content; no default value
An optional comment for JavaDocs; no default value
Indicates to use a primitive type; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates to mark the field as transient; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: field date
section.para: Adds a private date field to an existing Java source file

listitem.para: The name of the field to add; no default value (mandatory)
The Java type of the entity; no default value (mandatory)
The type of persistent storage to be used; no default value
The name of the class to receive this field; default if option not present: '*'
Whether this value cannot be null; default if option present: 'true'
Whether this value must be null; default if option present: 'true'
Whether this value must be in the future; default if option present: 'true'
Whether this value must be in the past; default if option present: 'true'
The JPA @Column name; no default value
An optional comment for JavaDocs; no default value
Inserts an optional Spring @Value annotation with the given content; no default value
Indicates to mark the field as transient; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates the style of the date format (ignored if dateTimeFormatPattern is specified); default: 'SHORT'
Indicates the style of the time format (ignored if dateTimeFormatPattern is specified); default: 'NONE'
Indicates a DateTime format pattern such as yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a; no default value

section.title: field embedded
section.para: Adds a private @Embedded field to an existing Java source file

listitem.para: The name of the field to add; no default value (mandatory)
The Java type of the @Embeddable class; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the @Entity class to receive this field; default if option not present: '*'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: field enum
section.para: Adds a private enum field to an existing Java source file

listitem.para: The name of the field to add; no default value (mandatory)
The enum type of this field; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the class to receive this field; default if option not present: '*'
The JPA @Column name; no default value
Whether this value cannot be null; default if option present: 'true'
Whether this value must be null; default if option present: 'true'
The fetch semantics at a JPA level; no default value
An optional comment for JavaDocs; no default value
Indicates to mark the field as transient; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: field number
section.para: Adds a private numeric field to an existing Java source file

listitem.para: The name of the field to add; no default value (mandatory)
The Java type of the entity; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the class to receive this field; default if option not present: '*'
Whether this value cannot be null; default if option present: 'true'
Whether this value must be null; default if option present: 'true'
The BigDecimal string-based representation of the minimum value; no default value
The BigDecimal string based representation of the maximum value; no default value
Maximum number of integral digits accepted for this number; no default value
Maximum number of fractional digits accepted for this number; no default value
The minimum value; no default value
The maximum value; no default value
The JPA @Column name; no default value
An optional comment for JavaDocs; no default value
Inserts an optional Spring @Value annotation with the given content; no default value
Indicates to mark the field as transient; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates to use a primitive type if possible; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates whether to mark the field with a unique constraint; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: field other
section.para: Inserts a private field into the specified file

listitem.para: The name of the field; no default value (mandatory)
The Java type of this field; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the class to receive this field; default if option not present: '*'
Whether this value cannot be null; default if option present: 'true'
Whether this value must be null; default if option present: 'true'
An optional comment for JavaDocs; no default value
The JPA @Column name; no default value
Inserts an optional Spring @Value annotation with the given content; no default value
Indicates to mark the field as transient; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: field reference
section.para: Adds a private reference field to an existing Java source file (eg the 'many' side of a many-to-one)

listitem.para: The name of the field to add; no default value (mandatory)
The Java type of the entity to reference; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the class to receive this field; default if option not present: '*'
Whether this value cannot be null; default if option present: 'true'
Whether this value must be null; default if option present: 'true'
The JPA @JoinColumn name; no default value
The JPA @JoinColumn referencedColumnName; no default value
The relationship cardinarily at a JPA level; default: 'MANY_TO_ONE'
The fetch semantics at a JPA level; no default value
An optional comment for JavaDocs; no default value
Indicates to mark the field as transient; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: field set
section.para: Adds a private Set field to an existing Java source file (eg the 'one' side of a many-to-one)

listitem.para: The name of the field to add; no default value (mandatory)
The entity which will be contained within the Set; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the class to receive this field; default if option not present: '*'
The field name on the referenced type which owns the relationship; no default value
Whether this value cannot be null; default if option present: 'true'
Whether this value must be null; default if option present: 'true'
The minimum number of elements in the collection; no default value
The maximum number of elements in the collection; no default value
The relationship cardinarily at a JPA level; default: 'MANY_TO_MANY'
The fetch semantics at a JPA level; no default value
An optional comment for JavaDocs; no default value
Indicates to mark the field as transient; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: field string
section.para: Adds a private string field to an existing Java source file

listitem.para: The name of the field to add; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the class to receive this field; default if option not present: '*'
Whether this value cannot be null; default if option present: 'true'
Whether this value must be null; default if option present: 'true'
The BigDecimal string-based representation of the minimum value; no default value
The BigDecimal string based representation of the maximum value; no default value
The minimum string length; no default value
The maximum string length; no default value
The required regular expression pattern; no default value
The JPA @Column name; no default value
Inserts an optional Spring @Value annotation with the given content; no default value
An optional comment for JavaDocs; no default value
Indicates to mark the field as transient; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates whether to mark the field with a unique constraint; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: Finder Commands
section.para: Finder Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.finder.FinderCommands.

section.title: finder add
section.para: Install finders in the given target (must be an entity)

listitem.para: The controller or entity for which the finders are generated; default if option not present: '*'
The finder string as generated with the 'finder list' command; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: finder list
section.para: List all finders for a given target (must be an entity)

listitem.para: The controller or entity for which the finders are generated; default if option not present: '*'
The depth of attribute combinations to be generated for the finders; default: '1'
A comma separated list of strings that must be present in a filter to be included; no default value

section.title: Gwt Commands
section.para: Gwt Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.gwt.GwtCommands.

section.title: gwt setup
section.para: Install Google Web Toolkit (GWT) into your project - deprecated, use 'web gwt setup' instead
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: web gwt setup
section.para: Install Google Web Toolkit (GWT) into your project
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: Hint Commands
section.para: Hint Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.classpath.operations.HintCommands.

section.title: hint
section.para: Provides step-by-step hints and context-sensitive guidance

listitem.para: The topic for which advice should be provided

section.title: Integration Test Commands
section.para: Integration Test Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.test.IntegrationTestCommands.

section.title: test integration
section.para: Creates a new integration test for the specified entity

listitem.para: The name of the entity to create an integration test for; default if option not present: '*'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: test mock
section.para: Creates a mock test for the specified entity

listitem.para: The name of the entity this mock test is targeting; default if option not present: '*'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: test stub
section.para: Creates a test stub for the specified class

listitem.para: The name of the class this mock test is targeting; default if option not present: '*'
Indicates whether reserved words are ignored by Roo; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: J Line Shell Component
section.para: J Line Shell Component are contained in org.springframework.roo.shell.jline.osgi.JLineShellComponent.
End of block comment
This command does not accept any options.
Start of block comment
This command does not accept any options.
Inline comment markers (start of line only)
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: date
section.para: Displays the local date and time
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: flash test
section.para: Tests message flashing
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: script
section.para: Parses the specified resource file and executes its commands

listitem.para: The file to locate and execute; no default value (mandatory)
Display line numbers when executing the script; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: system properties
section.para: Shows the shell's properties
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: version
section.para: Displays shell version

listitem.para: Special version flags; no default value

section.title: Jms Commands
section.para: Jms Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.jms.JmsCommands.

section.title: field jms template
section.para: insert a JmsTemplate field into an existing type

listitem.para: The name of the field to add; default: 'jmsTemplate'
The name of the class to receive this field; default if option not present: '*'
Indicates if the injected method should be executed asynchronously; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: jms listener class
section.para: Create a new class which is a asynchronous JMS consumer

listitem.para: The name of the class to create; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the destination; default: 'myDestination'
The type of the destination; default: 'QUEUE'

section.title: jms setup
section.para: Install a JMS provider in your project

listitem.para: The persistence provider to support; no default value (mandatory)
The name of the destination; default: 'myDestination'
The type of the destination; default: 'QUEUE'

section.title: Jpa Commands
section.para: Jpa Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.jpa.JpaCommands.

section.title: database properties list
section.para: Shows database configuration details
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: database properties remove
section.para: Removes a particular database property

listitem.para: The property key that should be removed; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: database properties set
section.para: Changes a particular database property

listitem.para: The property key that should be changed; no default value (mandatory)
The new vale for this property key; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: persistence setup
section.para: Install or updates a JPA persistence provider in your project

listitem.para: The persistence provider to support; no default value (mandatory)
The database to support; no default value (mandatory)
The Google App Engine application identifier to use; default if option not present: 'the project's name'
The JNDI datasource to use; no default value
The host name to use; no default value
The database name to use; no default value
The username to use; no default value
The password to use; no default value
The persistence unit name to be used in the persistence.xml file; no default value

section.title: Json Commands
section.para: Json Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.json.JsonCommands.

section.title: json add
section.para: Adds @RooJson annotation to target type

listitem.para: The java type to apply this annotation to; default if option not present: '*'
The root name which should be used to wrap the JSON document; no default value
Indication if deep serialization should be enabled.; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: json all
section.para: Adds @RooJson annotation to all types annotated with @RooJavaBean

listitem.para: Indication if deep serialization should be enabled; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: Jsp Commands
section.para: Jsp Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.web.mvc.jsp.JspCommands.

section.title: controller class
section.para: Create a new manual Controller (ie where you write the methods)

listitem.para: The path and name of the controller object to be created; no default value (mandatory)
Indicates a specific request mapping path for this controller (eg /foo/); no default value

section.title: web mvc controller
section.para: Create a new manual Controller (ie where you write the methods)

listitem.para: The path and name of the controller object to be created; no default value (mandatory)
Indicates a specific request mapping path for this controller (eg /foo/); no default value

section.title: web mvc install language
section.para: Install new internationalization bundle for MVC scaffolded UI.

listitem.para: The language code for the desired bundle; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: web mvc install view
section.para: Create a new static view.

listitem.para: The path the static view to create in (required, ie '/foo/blah'); no default value (mandatory)
The view name the mapping this view should adopt (required, ie 'index'); no default value (mandatory)
The title of the view; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: web mvc language
section.para: Install new internationalization bundle for MVC scaffolded UI.

listitem.para: The language code for the desired bundle; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: web mvc setup
section.para: Setup a basic project structure for a Spring MVC / JSP application
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: web mvc update tags
section.para: Replace an existing application tagx library with the latest version (use --backup option to backup your application first)

listitem.para: Backup your application before replacing your existing tag library; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: web mvc view
section.para: Create a new static view.

listitem.para: The path the static view to create in (required, ie '/foo/blah'); no default value (mandatory)
The view name the mapping this view should adopt (required, ie 'index'); no default value (mandatory)
The title of the view; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: Logging Commands
section.para: Logging Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.logging.LoggingCommands.

section.title: logging setup
section.para: Configure logging in your project

listitem.para: The log level to configure; no default value (mandatory)
The package to append the logging level to (all by default); no default value

section.title: Mail Commands
section.para: Mail Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.email.MailCommands.

section.title: email sender setup
section.para: Install a Spring JavaMailSender in your project

listitem.para: The host server; no default value (mandatory)
The protocol used by mail server; no default value
The port used by mail server; no default value
The encoding used for mail; no default value
The mail account username; no default value
The mail account password; no default value

section.title: email template setup
section.para: Configures a template for a SimpleMailMessage

listitem.para: The 'from' email (optional); no default value
The message subject (obtional); no default value

section.title: field email template
section.para: Inserts a MailTemplate field into an existing type

listitem.para: The name of the field to add; default: 'mailTemplate'
The name of the class to receive this field; default if option not present: '*'
Indicates if the injected method should be executed asynchronously; default if option present: 'true'; default if option not present: 'false'

section.title: Maven Commands
section.para: Maven Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.project.MavenCommands.

section.title: dependency add
section.para: Adds a new dependency to the Maven project object model (POM)

listitem.para: The group ID of the dependency; no default value (mandatory)
The artifact ID of the dependency; no default value (mandatory)
The version of the dependency; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: dependency remove
section.para: Removes an existing dependency from the Maven project object model (POM)

listitem.para: The group ID of the dependency; no default value (mandatory)
The artifact ID of the dependency; no default value (mandatory)
The version of the dependency; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: perform assembly
section.para: Executes the assembly goal via Maven
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: perform clean
section.para: Executes a full clean (including Eclipse files) via Maven
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: perform command
section.para: Executes a user-specified Maven command

listitem.para: User-specified Maven command (eg test:test); no default value (mandatory)

section.title: perform eclipse
section.para: Sets up Eclipse configuration via Maven (only necessary if you have not installed the m2eclipse plugin in Eclipse)
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: perform package
section.para: Packages the application using Maven, but does not execute any tests
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: perform tests
section.para: Executes the tests via Maven
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: project
section.para: Creates a new Maven project

listitem.para: The uppermost package name (this becomes the <groupId> in Maven and also the '~' value when using Roo's shell); no default value (mandatory)
The name of the project (last segment of package name used as default); no default value
Forces a particular major version of Java to be used (will be auto-detected if unspecified; specify 5 or 6 or 7 only); no default value

section.title: Metadata Commands
section.para: Metadata Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.classpath.MetadataCommands.

section.title: metadata cache
section.para: Shows detailed metadata for the indicated type

listitem.para: The maximum number of metadata items to cache; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: metadata for id
section.para: Shows detailed information about the metadata item

listitem.para: The metadata ID (should start with MID:); no default value (mandatory)

section.title: metadata for type
section.para: Shows detailed metadata for the indicated type

listitem.para: The Java type name to display metadata for; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: metadata status
section.para: Shows metadata statistics
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: metadata trace
section.para: Traces metadata event delivery notifications

listitem.para: The verbosity of notifications (0=none, 1=some, 2=all); no default value (mandatory)

section.title: Pgp Commands
section.para: Pgp Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.felix.pgp.PgpCommands.

section.title: pgp automatic trust
section.para: Indicates to automatically trust all keys encountered until the command is invoked again
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: pgp key view
section.para: Downloads a remote key and displays it to the user (does not change any trusts)

listitem.para: The key ID to view (eg 00B5050F or 0x00B5050F); no default value (mandatory)

section.title: pgp list trusted keys
section.para: Lists the keys you currently trust and have not been revoked at the time last downloaded from a public key server
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: pgp refresh all
section.para: Refreshes all keys from public key servers
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: pgp status
section.para: Displays the status of the PGP environment
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: pgp trust
section.para: Grants trust to a particular key ID

listitem.para: The key ID to trust (eg 00B5050F or 0x00B5050F); no default value (mandatory)

section.title: pgp untrust
section.para: Revokes your trust for a particular key ID

listitem.para: The key ID to remove trust from (eg 00B5050F or 0x00B5050F); no default value (mandatory)

section.title: Process Manager Commands
section.para: Process Manager Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.process.manager.ProcessManagerCommands.

section.title: development mode
section.para: Switches the system into development mode (greater diagnostic information)

listitem.para: Activates development mode; default: 'true'

section.title: poll now
section.para: Perform a manual file system poll
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: poll speed
section.para: Changes the file system polling speed

listitem.para: The number of milliseconds between each poll; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: poll status
section.para: Display file system polling information
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: Process Manager Diagnostics Listener
section.para: Process Manager Diagnostics Listener are contained in org.springframework.roo.process.manager.internal.ProcessManagerDiagnosticsListener.

section.title: process manager debug
section.para: Indicates if process manager debugging is desired

listitem.para: Activates debug mode; default: 'true'

section.title: Prop File Commands
section.para: Prop File Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.propfiles.PropFileCommands.

section.title: properties list
section.para: Shows the details of a particular properties file

listitem.para: Property file name (including .properties suffix); no default value (mandatory)
Source path to property file; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: properties remove
section.para: Removes a particular properties file property

listitem.para: Property file name (including .properties suffix); no default value (mandatory)
Source path to property file; no default value (mandatory)
The property key that should be removed; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: properties set
section.para: Changes a particular properties file property

listitem.para: Property file name (including .properties suffix); no default value (mandatory)
Source path to property file; no default value (mandatory)
The property key that should be changed; no default value (mandatory)
The new vale for this property key; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: Proxy Configuration Commands
section.para: Proxy Configuration Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.url.stream.jdk.ProxyConfigurationCommands.

section.title: proxy configuration
section.para: Shows the proxy server configuration
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: Security Commands
section.para: Security Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.security.SecurityCommands.

section.title: security setup
section.para: Install Spring Security into your project
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: Selenium Commands
section.para: Selenium Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.web.selenium.SeleniumCommands.

section.title: selenium test
section.para: Creates a new Selenium test for a particular controller

listitem.para: Controller to create a Selenium test for; no default value (mandatory)
Name of the test; no default value
URL of the server where the web application is available, including protocol, port and hostname; default: 'http://localhost:8080/'

section.title: Simple Parser Component
section.para: Simple Parser Component are contained in org.springframework.roo.shell.osgi.SimpleParserComponent.

section.title: help
section.para: Shows system help

listitem.para: Command name to provide help for; no default value

section.title: reference guide
section.para: Writes the reference guide XML fragments (in DocBook format) into the current working directory
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: Solr Commands
section.para: Solr Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.solr.SolrCommands.

section.title: solr add
section.para: Make target type searchable

listitem.para: The target type which is made searchable; default if option not present: '*'

section.title: solr all
section.para: Make all elegible project types searchable
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: solr setup
section.para: Install a support for Solr search integration

listitem.para: The Url of the Solr search server; default: 'http://localhost:8983/solr'

section.title: Uaa Commands
section.para: Uaa Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.uaa.UaaCommands.

section.title: download accept terms of use
section.para: Accepts the Spring User Agent Analysis (UAA) Terms of Use
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: download privacy level
section.para: Changes the Spring User Agent Analysis (UAA) privacy level

listitem.para: The new UAA privacy level to use; no default value (mandatory)

section.title: download reject terms of use
section.para: Rejects the Spring User Agent Analysis (UAA) Terms of Use
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: download status
section.para: Provides a summary of the Spring User Agent Analysis (UAA) status and commands
This command does not accept any options.

section.title: download view
section.para: Displays the Spring User Agent Analysis (UAA) header content in plain text

listitem.para: The file to save the UAA JSON content to; no default value

section.title: Web Flow Commands
section.para: Web Flow Commands are contained in org.springframework.roo.addon.web.flow.WebFlowCommands.

section.title: web flow
section.para: Install Spring Web Flow configuration artifacts into your project

listitem.para: The name for your web flow; no default value
